area_name: Cave Boulder aka Deer Carcass Boulder, The

climbs.name: Bambi
climbs.fa: Thomas Betterton? not sure if he was first!

content.description:
This is the sweet line of underclings and side pulls on the left side of the roof.  Sit start on jugs.  Pull big moves utilizing a bomber toe hook.  The first crux is a throw while cutting your feet, the second is finding the best way to control the jug at the end of the roof.  From the jug, make a small move with the right hand to a descent hold, then a loooong pull to a fairly shallow 2 finger pocket.  Lock off to the jug and finesse your way to the top....

AWESOME!

If you're not a V12 climber, stopping at the jug at the lip is V9ish and is well worth the time.
content.location: This is on the left side of the roof of the Cave Boulder.

content.description:
Start sitting on the right side of the cave on a low left hand crimp and with your right hand on the seam. Bump left up to the sidepull, make a hard right hand move to the crimpy pinch, and get into the jugs in the cave somehow. There are a few different ways to do this sequence. Once in the cave, throw a large right hand cross, cut your feet, and walk them out to the bicycle. Through some more cave climbing trickery, work your way to the jug rail right before the pocket on

Bambi

, and finish out there.

This route is 20+ moves long and has classic cave climbing with surprisingly good flow. It was first done by Daniel Woods and graded V14, since then it was downgraded to V13.
content.protection: Pads.  Either a lot or someone to move them for you.

content.description: Climb the left (south side) of the Bambi Boulder out its tallest line. Start on the large, double handed jug down low, and climb straight up through the crux of the boulder (the first 7 moves) and then on to some crimps, pockets, and eventually some reachy moves up high. The climbing up high is not crazy hard; however, there are some moves on slopey edges. Good news, the edges are solid, and no holds feel like they could break.
content.location: This is on the south side of the Bambi Boulder.

pathTokens: Cave Boulder aka Deer Carcass Boulder, The
